subject: Customs
description_text:
My package has been seized by slovak customs. It seems the invoice they
recieved the pedals have a value of 56USD. Customs asked for

1. "proof of payment (bank statement of payment, payment confirmation or
PayPal confirmation)"

2. "confirmed e-mail order, where the goods are listed with the amounts +
possibly added postage or applied discount"

3. "form in the attachment with the exact description of the goods in
Slovak language"

4. "form of authorization in the attachment"

Now wouldnt it be a problem that both the proof of statement and email
order shows the value of the pedals not at 56USD but at 200+ USD?

conversations.body_text: Hello, we apologize for the inconvenience caused. You may use this invoice for customs clearance. Should any additional taxes apply, we will reimburse you for a portion of them. Please rest assured.

This is great, thank you. However how do I even get a slovak description of
the product? I mean I assume there is no such document prepared by your
company. Do i just make a manual description or translate it?

On Wed, 27 Aug 2025, 9:47 am service@simsonn.com,
Hi Arnold Ivan,    We are sorry that we do not have Slovak invoices available. You may translate this English version and submit it alongside the original.

The customs investigation came through and i got charged an additional 84€.
Can i get that partial reimbursement?

On Wed, 27 Aug 2025, 11:58 am service@simsonn.com,
Hello, we have refunded the charges related to ‘poplatky za colno deklaračné služby ’ on your behalf.
